item.title: Tim Pritlove
item.description: Eine sehr lehrreiche Woche in der Ukraine, die sich anf√ºhlt wie ein Monat, ist jetzt vorbei. Ich war in Lwiw, Kyiv und Odessa. In Odessa gab es in der Nacht einen Angriff der Russen mit Shahed-Drohnen. Obwohl die meisten von der Flugabwehr abgeschossen werden konnten, traf eine Drohne ein Wohnhaus 12 km entfernt von meinem Hotel und t√∂tete dort laut Berichten insgesamt 10 Menschen. Russland f√ºhrt Krieg gegen Europa und nicht nur gegen die Ukraine. Wenn wir sie nicht stoppen, geht es so weiter.

item.title: Kristin Branson
item.description:
Bumblebees socially learn behaviour too complex to innovate alone
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-024-07126-4#MOESM3
"Culture refers to behaviours that are socially learned and persist within a population over time. Increasing evidence suggests that animal culture can, like human culture, be cumulative: characterized by sequential innovations that build on previous ones... This suggests that social learning might permit the acquisition of behaviours too complex to ‚Äòre-innovate‚Äô through individual learning."

item.title: Matteo Carandini
item.description: @computingnature Thanks for pointing out this interesting lecture! There clearly is no "representational drift" in prefrontal cortex, when behavior is stable. It would have been nice to see activity of those same neurons 2 months later when the task goes back to the original one. For others who might be interested, here is the link with a timestamp at the beginning of the talk: https://www.youtube.com/live/Kq5f36OwFKU?si=4KQ6iBNgcWDydwqQ&t=4098

item.description:

https://www.jneurosci.org/content/44/10/e1236232023
#neuroscience

item.title: Ulrike Hahn
item.description: @NicoleCRust @emma_cogdev the thing I still don‚Äòt get is that data faking seems to me to cut out the only bit about science that is truly fun/rewarding: finding out something about the world..ethics applications? writing? dragging papers through the publication process? all annoying activities worth it only for finding out something new and interesting‚Ä¶.why bother?

item.title: Ulrike Hahn
item.description: @mrcompletely @NicoleCRust @emma_cogdev I don‚Äòt really want to dissuade you from thinking well of me, but my bafflement at Stapel isn‚Äòt moral, it‚Äòs instrumental: occasions of external positive feedback seem far and few between in academia, so if you don‚Äòt intrinsically enjoy what you are doing it‚Äòs not a great place to be, but there seems little to nothing left to intrinsically enjoy if you are just making things up.

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Volunteer outsiders doing a far better job than French authorities and institutions...https://www.science.org/content/article/failure-every-level-how-science-sleuths-exposed-massive-ethics-violations-famed-french
